titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for four-year terms for Representatives and to provide that no person may serve as a Representative for more than twelve years.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.

bill.summary: 1/7/1997--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Increases the term of office of a Member of the House of Representative to four years. Prohibits a person from serving more than 12 years as a Representative.
